body: I like the idea, feel free to submit a pull request

I made the change...it's like two lines in index.html; but I can't build the project on my machine to test it.

I think there's something wrong with my `GOPATH` or maybe it's a Windows thing? I dunno...golang incompetence wasn't covered in [the guide](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/wiki/Building) :)

```
    D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing>go run build.go build
    GOPATH is D:\
    rm -r syncthing.exe
    rm -r syncthing.exe.md5
    GOPATH=D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace;D:\
    go build -ldflags -w -X main.Version v0.10.27+25-g5c026cb -X main.BuildStamp 1426770167 -X main.BuildUser blake_desktop\
    Blake -X main.BuildHost BLAKE_DESKTOP -X main.BuildEnv default ./cmd/syncthing
    cmd\syncthing\gui.go:27:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/auto" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\auto (from $GOROOT)
            D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\auto (from
    $GOPATH)
            D:\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\auto
    cmd\syncthing\gui.go:28:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/config" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\config (from $GOROOT)
            D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\config (fro
    m $GOPATH)
            D:\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\config
    cmd\syncthing\gui.go:29:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/db" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\db (from $GOROOT)
            D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\db (from $G
    OPATH)
            D:\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\db
    cmd\syncthing\gui.go:30:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/discover" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\discover (from $GOROOT)
            D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\discover (f
    rom $GOPATH)
            D:\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\discover
    cmd\syncthing\connections.go:18:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/events" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\events (from $GOROOT)
            D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\events (fro
    m $GOPATH)
            D:\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\events
    cmd\syncthing\connections.go:19:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/model" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\model (from $GOROOT)
            D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\model (from
     $GOPATH)
            D:\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\model
    cmd\syncthing\gui.go:33:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/osutil" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\osutil (from $GOROOT)

            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\symlinks (from $GOROOT)
            D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\symlinks (f
    rom $GOPATH)
            D:\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\symlinks
    cmd\syncthing\gui.go:34:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/upgrade" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\upgrade (from $GOROOT)
            D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\upgrade (fr
    om $GOPATH)
            D:\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\upgrade
    cmd\syncthing\main.go:39:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/upnp" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\upnp (from $GOROOT)

    $GOPATH)

    exit status 1
    exit status 1
```

hmm...`build.sh assets` seemed to work, but not the second.

Go binary is in, `C:\Go\bin`
Project is in, `D:\projects\github\syncthing`

...anything else I should try or be aware of?

Really regretting not playing with Go before now.
What is the error you are getting when running build?

```
    D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing>build.sh

    Welcome to Git (version 1.9.0-preview20140217)

    Run 'git help git' to display the help index.
    Run 'git help <command>' to display help for specific commands.
    GOPATH is D:\
    GOPATH=D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace;D:\

    go install -v -ldflags -w -X main.Version v0.10.27+25-g5c026cb-dirty -X main.BuildStamp 1426770167 -X main.BuildUser blake_desktop\Blake -X main.BuildHost BLAKE_DESKTOP -X main.BuildEnv default ./cmd/...

    cmd\stcompdirs\main.go:19:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/symlinks" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\symlinks (from $GOROOT)
            D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\symlinks (from $GOPATH)
            D:\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\symlinks
    cmd\stfileinfo\main.go:16:2: cannot find package "github.com/syncthing/syncthing/internal/scanner" in any of:
            C:\Go\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\scanner (from $GOROOT)
            D:\projects\github\syncthing\syncthing\Godeps\_workspace\src\github.com\syncthing\syncthing\internal\scanner (from $GOPATH)
    ...
    ...
    exit status 1
    exit status 1
```

Right, you cannot build go code like that, I know it's annoying.
In needs to be in src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/
For example D:/projects/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/
Then you need to set GOPATH=D:/projects/go

And on Linux? Tons of Devs are experiencing troubles builing Syncthing on their servers. Are you aware of this situation?

~~How it's done no matter what~~
http://meshfields.de/install-go1-4-syncthing-on-ubuntu-server/
Above wont work either... sorry to say. Just too much errors. 2h+ is too long for installing a tool.

https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/wiki/Building
https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/wiki/Building-with-Docker
And in general: `./build.sh` usually just works.

Tons of devs are not reading the wiki then I guess.
The docker container has everything you need to build.
The Guide you linked to won't work. Please read my blog. I face so many errors, exceeding the amount of fingers on both my hands.

More than 80% of your blog post is about building Go 1.4, which we don't really have control off.
Hence why we provide the docker container so that you could skip all of that.

Regarding the error you are getting, I suggest you try building the v0.10 branch which is supposed to be stable, and not master, as that's definitely unstable.

Furthermore, you are downloading calmh's fork (calmh/syncthing rather than syncthing/syncthing), which is full of dev stuff and might not even build...

I appreciate your quick help Audrius, anyway I need to complain again:

> # This should output "go version go1.3" or higher.
> 
> -- Official Syncthing Wiki

Maybe you should consider dropping the "or higher" and change it to "Please note: only go 1.3 will work"
That's not true, we build it with 1.4 for official releases, and I build it with 1.4.1 or even tip of go in dev
Didn't you just say 1.4 is a bad idea?

rename.from: Show Device ID QR code in "Edit Device" popup. [Enhancement] [UI] [easy]
rename.to: Show Device ID QR code in "Edit Device" popup

issue.title: Show Device ID QR code in "Edit Device" popup

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body: As suggested by #1494. @blakev said he wrote a patch to do this, but had trouble building and never submitted a pull request AFAIK. I'm not great with css/boostrap, so feel free to rewrite how the qr button is displayed in the edit device modal. I tested this and it works fine. Closing the device edit modal to open the idqr modal is a little awkward, but I'm not sure how else to do it. I would appreciate feedback, this is my first time contributing to syncthing!
